intro: Gastrosiphon scutellifer, commonly known as the scarlet sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its striking, bright red to orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in its native arid environments. It typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to saline conditions. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a notable species in botanical gardens and coastal ecosystems.
